questions.text: Which of Carla's kids had to be held back?
questions.explanation:
Ann Marie.

	Ann Marie was Carla's fourth child. Nick Tortelli was the father of Carla's first five children.

questions.text: What personal record was Coach trying to break?
questions.correct: the least amount of beer glasses broken in a month
options: the least amount of days without a fire
the least amount of money missing from the register
the least amount of days of missed work
questions.explanation:
the least amount of beer glasses broken in a month.

	Coach had the floor behind the bar covered in feathers. Near the end he started to get a little cocky and took out the feathers and started breaking glasses on purpose. When there was two left he said he was scared.

questions.text: Who was Norm's friend in this episode?
questions.explanation:
George.

	James Gallery played George. Gallery was born March 24, 1935 in Auburn, NY. He died in 2001 in California.

questions.text: Who always took George Washington's birthday weekend off?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Sam always went skiing on that weekend. He traditionally went to hook up with different women so he lied to Diane, not wanting her to know where he was going and why.

Uncle Nathan.

	Sam fabricated this whole story about having an Uncle Nathan. He then headed off for his weekend of fun.

questions.text: Where did Sam say the funeral was?
questions.explanation:
Vermont.

	He planned to go skiing up at Stowe in Vermont. So he told Diane his uncle's funeral was in VT, giving himself a reason to go.

questions.text: How did Sam say his relative died?
questions.explanation:
Hit by a bus.

	Coach asked if he was sick long. When Sam said he was hit by a bus, Coach responded, "Oh well that's comforting."

questions.text: Did the Bruins win or lose the game that Norm went to?
questions.explanation:
win.

	In this episode the Bruins played the Islanders. They won 8-7 in overtime.

questions.text: Who kept leaving and coming back?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Every time Sam would leave Diane would say something to bring him back. Carla had told Diane about Sam going to to Stowe to ski. Diane believed Sam would return and each time he did. Carla thought it was over for Sam and Diane.

questions.text: Did Diane call to check about Sam's uncle dying?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Sam ended up confessing everything to Diane because he believed she already knew. It turned out she never called so he told on himself for no reason.
